value.title: New flexible, steerable device placed in live brains by minimally invasive robot
value.excerpt: Imperial College London scientists have successfully placed a bioinspired steerable catheter into the brain of an animal for the first time.

value.title: Soft Robotics Demonstrates mGripAI™ at Pack Expo International 2022
value.excerpt: Today Soft Robotics Inc. announced that they will be showcasing m GripAI in multiple booths at the Pack Expo International Exposition, October 23-26, 2022, at the McCormick Center in Chicago, Illinois.

value.title: Katakem’s ‘robot chef’ speeds up drug development with reliable chemistry
value.excerpt: Katakem, which is developing a robot to automate lab tasks, is among the many startups presenting at the TechCrunch Disrupt Battlefield 200.

value.title: Generally Intelligent secures cash from OpenAI vets to build capable AI systems
value.excerpt: Generally Intelligent, a research startup with backing from OpenAI vets, is aiming to develop general-purpose AI systems.

value.title: Tired of laundry folding? AI breaks the robot folding speed record
value.excerpt: While it's possible that someone out there enjoys folding clothes, it's probably not a beloved pastime. Accordingly, researchers at UC Berkeley's AUTOLAB have developed a new robotic method of folding garments at record speed (for a robot) called SpeedFolding.

value.title: XR R1 brings hexapod robotics to tech-savvy consumers
value.excerpt: It often seems that soon after a new type of scientific or industrial robot is unveiled, a hobbyist model follows. First, there were the Bittle and Mini Pupper miniature quadrupeds – now, there's the XR R1 hexapod.

value.title: Watch Google’s Ping-Pong robot pull off a 340-hit rally
value.excerpt: Google researchers have used an interesting method to create a powerful (but friendly) Ping-Pong bot capable of returning hundreds of times.

value.title: AI Law And AI Ethics Deeply Disturbed By That Recent “History-Making Moment” Of An AI Robot Testifying To The UK Parliament
value.excerpt: An AI robot spoke to the UK Parliament in a committee hearing, which has been heralded as historic and meanwhile scoffed at as being nothing more than a cheap stunt. We take a close look at what occurred and examine the true limits of AI and robots.

value.title: AI-Driven Automation And Human-Driven Management Of The Business Of Data

value.title: Baristas in San Francisco went on strike. Their robot co-workers went right on serving
value.excerpt: The coming robot apocalypse threatens to pit humans against machines. Here's how to make peace with your future coworkers, before it's too late.

value.title: Ambi Robotics Raises $32M in Funding
value.excerpt: Ambi Robotics, a Berkeley, CA-based robotics company, raised $32M in funding. The round was led by Tiger Global and Bow Capital with participation from Ahren and Pitney Bowes. The company intends to use the funds to achieve several milestones over the next 12 months,

value.title: We are entering a new era for AI-powered robotics
value.excerpt: Humanoid robots are yet to roam the world but with advancements like Tesla's "Optimus," we are embarking on the era of AI-powered robotics.

value.title: Pace Of Artificial Intelligence Investments Slows, But AI Is Still Hotter Than Ever
value.excerpt: Private companies using AI are expected to raise 36% less money in 2022 versus the previous year, but are still on track to exceed the 2020 level.

value.title: 'Delicious' chocolate bar developed by robots using artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: Its makers predict their treat, containing milk chocolate, cookie crumbs and nuts, will please just about everybody in the galaxy. Their prototype contains 30% less sugar than conventional chocolate

value.title: Cobb Douglas Robot Announces the Launch of Conga: An AI-Powered, Autonomous Robotic Lawn Mower
value.excerpt: With a single click to start, Conga sets users free from the tedious task of lawn mowing. Unlike the first-generation robots, this highly advanced lawn care robot does not require the installation of copper boundary wire or the use of remote control to manually map the areas to be cut.

value.title: A remote-controlled car with a flag on a pole can herd cattle
value.excerpt: A small remote-controlled vehicle proved effective at keeping cows away from overgrazed areas, and the animals showed few signs of fear or aggression

value.title: AI Shouldn’t Compete With Workers—It Should Supercharge Them
value.excerpt: The economy could get a boost if machine learning engineers switched from copying human abilities to augmenting them.

value.title: 3 Unexpected Industries Robots Will Improve
value.excerpt: Robots may be taking over the world, but in the best way possible. Robotic technology is sparking innovation in several industries, including three you might not have considered.

value.title: A|I: The AI Times – Gatik and Loblaw give Canadians driverless deliveries
value.excerpt: The AI Times is a weekly newsletter covering the biggest AI, machine learning, big data, and automation news from around the globe.

value.title: Robot artist Ai-Da reset while speaking to UK politicians
value.excerpt: Ai-Da, the world's first ultra-realistic humanoid robot artist, answered questions from UK lawmakers during a session hosted by the House of Lords Communications and Digital Committee, according to Reuters.

value.title: SoftBank Robotics partners with Gausium to deploy 2 robotic solutions
value.excerpt: SoftBank Robotics America and Gausium announced a new partnership to deploy indoor automated robots in the US.

value.title: Is artificial intelligence inching closer to sentience?
value.excerpt: Chatbots are starting to muse about life, death and religion. But could these silicon philosophers one day gain consciousness? Or are they just getting good at mimicking it?
